recommendations.recommendation: Surprisingly deep, mature, very realistic and highly entertaining series. The best anime of the current season.
Not too much humor but excellent story and at the times emocional, but all in all a very decent watch.
The most feel good show there ever was. It just feels good. Good.

anime.description: Recap: http://anidb.net/ch55012 [Hachiken Yuugo] is a mild-mannered academic who chooses to move away from his sub-urban lifestyle and enrol at the Yezo Agricultural High School in the country because of strained relations with his family. He soon finds himself slowly getting used to his new environment with a short learning curve and grows into an empathetic and compassionate individual as he struggles to understand the world of agriculture and how it affects the lives of his new friends. (Source: Wikipedia) As the new semester begins at Yezo Agricultural High School, Yuugo is now used to the tough lifestyle of a rural high school, while still wondering what he will do in the future... Source: ANN

tag.name: baseball
tag.description: Baseball is like a complicated version of Rounders. It involves hitting a ball with a stick, then running around several bases placed in the form of a diamond on a field. Big in the US, and also in Japan.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: horse riding
tag.description: Equestrianism (from Latin equester, equestr-, horseman, horse) more often known as riding, horseback riding (American English) or horse riding (British English) refers to the skill of riding, driving, or vaulting with horses. This broad description includes the use of horses for practical working purposes, transportation, recreational activities, artistic or cultural exercises, and competitive sport.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school dormitory
tag.description: A school dormitory or residence hall is the student living quarters at an elite academy, boarding school, or military school. The main characters may live or work at the dormitory, and it often becomes the backdrop for a reoccurring part of the story.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: noitaminA
tag.description: noitaminA (ノイタミナ) – Animation written backwards – is a Fuji Television programming block, devoted to anime, broadcast each Thursday night from 00:45 to 1:15. It was launched with the intention of expanding the target audience beyond the typical young male demographic. The timeslot was expanded from half an hour to a full hour in 2010, and now airs Thursday nights from 00:45 to 1:45. noitaminA aired its first non-anime series in 2010, with the premiere of the live-action adaptation of Moyashimon. On April 15, 2010, Fuji TV and FUNimation announced an agreement that allows FUNimation to simulcast series from the noitaminA block in North America within an hour of their airing in Japan.

tag.name: everybody is nice
tag.description: All characters are nice in their own way; nobody has ill intentions to others. Even if a secondary character appears to be bad at the beginning, they will redeem themselves or become tamed/pacified/neutralized swiftly.

tag.name: hard work and guts
tag.description: One of the character`s motto in the anime. Because there is nothing that cannot be achieved by hard work and guts.

tag.name: motivational anime
tag.description: The anime motivates doing something which is shown in the show (for example club activity, sports, choosing a job, a hobby etc).

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: dreams
tag.description: Waking or sleeping, the mind can go to some strange places, usually beyond the control of the dreamer. New worlds, strange creatures, unfulfilled fantasies, they are all there. Sometimes a person`s dreams can be taken over, with catastrophic consequences for the character and sometimes the real world.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: agriculture
tag.description: Agriculture is the cultivation of animals, plants, fungi, and other life forms for food, fiber, biofuel, medicinal and other products used to sustain and enhance human life. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: educational
tag.description: The entire series (at least a major part of it) is centred on a particular subject. Information is fed to the audience in a sublime manner. Most of the time an on-screen written comment by the narrator (or translator) can be seen, e.g. biological specimen, medicine, process, etc. Sometimes at the end of every episode’s closing song, a 20 seconds educational clip is presented.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Hachiken Yuugo
character.description: Hachiken Yuugo is a city boy from Sapporo. After failing to pass the entrance exams for the high school of his preference, Yuugo decided to enroll at Yezo instead, believing that easier academic course would leave him with more time to prepare for college exams. However, the agricultural courses` demand for hard labor proved his assumptions wrong. Due to his father`s strict upbringing, he is somehow unable to refuse when someone needs his help. Despite complaining a lot when he feels people are abusing of his generosity, Yuugo quickly earns the friendship and respect of his peers. Just after enrolling, he joins the Equestrian Club along his classmate Aki, soon rising to the position of vice-president due to his reliable nature. Yuugo is usually anxious about his future as, unlike his classmates who already have set their goals in life, he is still wondering about what career he should choose. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Komaba Ichirou
character.description: Komaba Ichirou is one of Yuugo`s close friends and a skilled baseball player, Komaba dreams of becoming a professional ball player so he can use the money he earns in the league to improve his family`s dairy farm. He is also Aki`s childhood friend and neighbour, and their closeness is a constant source of jealousy for Yuugo. However, once Komaba`s family goes bankrupt and their farm is sold to pay their debt, he is forced to quit Yezo and look for a job to make ends meet. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Tokiwa Keiji
character.description: Tokiwa Keiji is a close friend of Yuugo who has a talent to put himself in trouble due to his difficulty to study and his habit to jump too quickly into conclusions, much to his friends` chagrin. His family owns a chicken farm. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Inada Tamako
character.description: Inada Tamako is a rich classmate of Yuugo whose family runs a huge industrial farm. Usually an obese girl, under the extra fat she hides a quite beautiful figure that reveals itself occasionally when she works too hard or gets herself into a quick diet. However she feels too weak when she is thinner thus it does not take much time for her to regain all the weight she had previously lost. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Aikawa Shinnosuke
character.description: Aikawa Shinnosuke is another close friend of Yuugo and member of the Holstein club, Aikawa aims to become a veterinarian despite his tendency to faint at the sight of blood. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Mikage Aki
character.description: Mikage Aki is a first year who is also a member of the Equestrian Club and Yuugo`s love interest. She is studying to inherit her family business, a cow and horse farm specialising in raising Ban`ei race horses. Aki usually has a cheerful and positive attitude and she eventually develops feelings for Yuugo, leading to them start dating. Her father is very protective and was wary of her relationship with Yuugo at first, but some time later starts seeing him as a man worthy of becoming her husband, just like the rest of her family. Once her family goes into difficulties and is forced to sell all their horses, Aki, encouraged by Yuugo, expresses her will to not inherit the farm and become a professional jockey instead. Thus she starts studying to enter college with his help. Another curious trait of Aki`s is that she is so enthusiastic about horses that she can easily memorise every fact related to them, thus Yuugo makes use of it to help with her studies. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Hachiken Shingo
character.description: Hachiken Shingo is Yuugo`s older brother who managed to enroll in the University of Tokyo, known as the most prestigious of Japan, but dropped out soon after, as he decided to run after his own dream, once he realised his father`s dream of having one of his sons accepted there. Aiming to be a great cook, he travels the country to perfect his cooking skills with questionable results, and usually drops by Yezo to pay a visit to his brother, despite Yuugo`s animosity towards him. During his travels, Shingo meets a Russian girl and ends up marrying her. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Ookawa Shin`ei
character.description: Ookawa Shin`ei is in the third year. He is a member of equestrian club.

character.name: Toyonishi Mika
character.description: Toyonishi Mika is in the third year. She is a member of equestrian club.

character.name: Sakae Manami
character.description: Sakae Manami is in the first year. She is a member of equestrian club.

character.name: Maruyama Noboru
character.description: Maruyama is in the first year. He is a member of equestrian club.

character.name: Kino Hiroyuki
character.description: Kino Hiroyuki is in the first year. He is a member of equestrian club.

character.name: Mikage Sousobo
character.description: Aki`s great-grandmother.

character.name: Mikage Haha
character.description: Aki`s mother.

character.name: Mikage Goushi
character.description: Aki`s father.

character.name: Mikage Sobo
character.description: Aki`s grandmother.

character.name: Mikage Sofu
character.description: Aki`s grandfather.

character.name: Komaba Misora
character.description: Ichirou`s younger sister.

character.name: Komaba Nino
character.description: Ichirou`s younger sister.

character.name: Komaba Haha
character.description: Ichirou`s mother.

character.name: Hachiken Misako
character.description: Yuugo and Shingo`s mother.

character.name: Hachiken Chichi
character.description: Yuugo and Shingo`s father.

character.name: Inada Tamako
character.description: Tamako lost weight over summer holidays. Second time she lost weigth for the school festival.

character.name: Yoda Manabu
character.description: Yoda Manabu is in the second year. He is a member of equestrian club and a president of the club after the third years quit.

character.name: Matsuzawa
character.description: Matsuzawa is a woman who rides a horse named Takakura.

character.name: Ishiyama
character.description: Ishiyama is a boy from junior high who rides a horse named Rosanne.

character.name: Aoyama Rei
character.description: Aoyama Rei is Komaba`s roommate. Note: Seiyuu of this character was an actor of Hachiken in Gin no Saji live-action adaptation.

episode.title: 八軒, 副部長になる
Hachiken Becomes the Club Vice President
Hachiken le vice-président
Hachiken, Fukubuchou ni Naru
episode.summary: Hachiken`s second semester is about to begin, and it is now fall in Hokkaido. In the equestrian club, the upperclassmen are retiring. Hachiken is appointed the club`s new vice president. He is thrilled, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 南九条, あらわる
Minamikujou Appears
Minamikujô fait son entrée !
Minamikujou, Arawaru
episode.summary: The day of the Freshman War has come, and Hachiken and his teammates grapple with anxiety at their first real competition. Then, Mikage`s childhood friend, Minamikujou Ayame appears... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 八軒, 高く跳ぶ
Hachiken Jumps High
Hachiken s`envole
Hachiken, Takaku Tobu
episode.summary: Hachiken`s crew attempts show jumping in preparation for the fall competition. As his team mates clear their first obstacle with ease, Hachiken finds himself being the only one unable to jump, with Maron refusing to do as he asks... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 八軒, 副ぶちょーを拾う
Hachiken Adopts Vice Prez
Hachiken trouve un vice-président
Hachiken, Fukubuchoo o Hirou
episode.summary: Although Hachiken is perturbed by Mikage`s tears, the semester wears on with students participating in the usual campus clean-up. Following Hachiken`s discovery of the brick oven in the previous clean-up, makes yet another surprising discovery... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 八軒, 咆える
Hachiken Howls
Le cri d`Hachiken
Hachiken, Hoeru
episode.summary: The Hokkaido baseball tournament has ended, but Komaba has not come back to school. An unexpected visitor appears in front of Komaba`s worried classmates... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 駒場, マウンドに立つ
Komaba Stands on the Pitcher`s Mound
Komaba sur le monticule
Komaba, Mound ni Tatsu
episode.summary: With Komaba`s help, the baseball club is two wins away from the spring prelims. Meanwhile, Hachiken finally manages to go on a date with Mikage, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 御影, 奮闘す
Mikage Gives It Her All
Mikage se surpasse
Mikage, Funtousu
episode.summary: Ezonoo Festival has finally begun, and the equestrian club`s horse racing event is a hit with the visitors. But Hachiken is nowhere to be found... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 八軒, 大わらわ
Hachiken Has His Hands Full
Hachiken se démène
Hachiken, Oowarawa
episode.summary: As the Ezonoo Festival looms closer, Hachiken is drowning in prep work. The equestrian club decides to create a giant race course to demonstrate ban`ei racing, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 何度でも
Over and Over Again
Tout
Nando demo
episode.summary: Hachiken returns to his family home for Mikage`s sake and his. He finally confronts his father. Winter is coming... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夢
Dream
Rêve
Yume
episode.summary: Mikage finally opens up to her family about her dream. Hachiken begins to help Mikage prepare for college entrance exams, but she is not making progress as quickly as he`d like... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後の牛乳
The Last Milk
Le meilleur lait
Saigo no Gyuunyuu
episode.summary: Hachiken`s crew learns about the situation at the Komaba Ranch. Hachiken vows not to "let go of the reins" even in tough times, and heads to the ranch with Mikage. Source: crunchyroll
